countries.fact: The U.S. has the world's largest economy and is home to Silicon Valley.
China is the most populous country in the world.
India is the largest democracy in the world.
Russia is the largest country by land area, spanning 11 time zones.
Brazil is the largest coffee producer in the world.
Indonesia is the largest archipelago in the world with over 17,000 islands.
Pakistan is home to K2, the second-highest peak in the world.
Nigeria is the most populous country in Africa.
Bangladesh has one of the highest population densities in the world.
Mexico introduced chocolate, chilies, and corn to the world.
Japan has the oldest population, with more than 28% aged 65 or older.
Ethiopia is considered the birthplace of coffee.
The Philippines has over 7,600 islands.
Egypt is home to the Great Pyramid of Giza, the only remaining Wonder of the Ancient World.
Vietnam is a leading exporter of rice and coffee.
Turkey is located on two continents, Europe and Asia.
Germany is known for its engineering and is the largest economy in Europe.
France is the most visited country in the world, with over 89 million tourists annually.
The UK is home to the world's oldest underground railway, the London Underground.
Italy has the most UNESCO World Heritage Sites of any country, with 58 sites.
